DOC.detailed_description: Adipose tissue central organ mediate metabolic health . There evidence woman polycystic ovary syndrome ( PCOS ) degree adipose tissue dysfunction may negatively affect metabolic health . The aim study assess transcriptomic profile subcutaneous adipose tissue woman PCOS comparison control population match basis age body mass index ( BMI ) . A secondary aim relate gene expression profile biochemical environment .
DOC.criteria: Had positive diagnosis PCOS define accord NIH criterion chronic oligomenorrhoea ( < 9 menstrual cycle per year ) clinical and/or biochemical evidence hyperandrogenism , absence disorder cause phenotype . Clinical criterion include hirsutism FerrimanGalwey score great 9 , acne male pattern alopecia ; biochemical criterion include totaltestosterone , androstenedione dehydroepiandrosterone sulphate ( DHEAS ) great laboratory reference range . Were age 18 40 Were 18 year great 40 year old , Were nonCaucasian Were pregnant , lactate try conceive Had body mass index ( BMI ) < 18kg/m2 > 50kg/m2 Had recent illness chronic illness likely influence result Were take hormonal contraception
